TopicTitle: Pteron Micro Shuttle and rescue vehicle Beta download available(9/9/2014)

Articles.Content:
Guys, I'm having a hard time importing a hull + landing gear. Also, I think we should separate the landing gear from the hull. But Daemoria's model can't do that. Another thing is it's over-sized as you have seen in the first picture. So I would ask you. Would you agree for a reboot where I remodel (I'll stick to Daemoria's and the initial concept style), or should I just continue? I wouldn't mind to continue but... you know. Also, the landing gear isn't too detailed. I'll do some improvements if I remodel. PM-ing Sage too for this.

You do what ever is best for you and whatever is going to produce the best MOD. There are many of us myself included who are chomping at the bit to get our hands o this mod but I am sure I can speak for all of us when I say it we want the best working MOD possible. So its up to you.
your mod, you decide.... we will all be here when you are ready for us to fly it.
Right... Now I'll just wait for Sage's response to this.
Errm, the scale is just a parameter you need to change, it's trivial, for the landing gear you could just chop of the landing gear into it's own part, also pretty trivial.

I know, I did it. Just that it's BIG. Really big, I'm a fan of rescaleFactor = 1 because the scale is 1:1 . Also, I'd rather make an encased landing gear than one that shows up with a floating suspension and doors.

Don't need to change the size using rescaleFactor, just need to change the size of the model, as much as I dislike KSO you can take a cue from how they did it, rectangle removed from the main model where you connect a landing gear model that fills the hole to make a flush part when not deployed.

Hey all sorry for the sporadic nature of my posting at the moment but IRL shenanigans are keeping me from The Kerbalverse. For the sake of clarity I will post my message to Blackheart:

"Sorry for the delayed response. Hmmm it's entirely up to you Blackheart, I really liked Daemorias model but if it is proving a pain in the butt to get the landing gear right and you are willing to have another go at the model then by all means.

The work you have done on the Aerojet proves that you are a talented person when it comes to modelling, I just worry that starting from scratch will mean a bunch more work for you.

I do like the idea of the landing gear being a part of the main fuselage, one of the driving ideas behind the concept was to keep a very low part count so that multiple Pterons could be attached to a space station without killing peoples P.C.s.

So I guess, in the end what I am saying is: have a go at a new model if you are willing. Just remember...small,simple and Sexy.

Oh and lastly if you are going to take another run at the model is it possible to have skids rather than wheels? My initial sketches had skids which I thought were rather *****ing looking and had the benefit of keeping the shock absorber geometry simple.

Once again thanks for all the hard work so far and I look forward to any model ideas you come up with."

Whilst everyone is making suggestions...Small hatch on the side near the windows or hatch on the top of the fuselage? A hatch on the top design would allow for a future un-kerballed cargo variant.

I like the exit out the top as it would allow for bail-outs easier without wing strikes.
